law.catch_line: The Advisory Council consists of 15 members appointed by the Governor....

section.section: The Advisory Council consists of 15 members appointed by the Governor.
The term of a member is 4 years.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Advisory Council on July 1, 1989.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: The Governor may remove a member for incompetence or misconduct.
